intro: Nassauvia digitata, commonly known as the mountain mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, pale pink to white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. Nassauvia digitata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is used in native plant landscaping.
